qas.question: In what year did the fall of Constantinople happen?
When is the modern period dated in England?
Who was defeated by Henry Vll at the battle of Bosworth?

context: Many major events caused Europe to change around the start of the 16th century, starting with the Fall of Constantinople in <a0_0>1453<a0_0/>, the fall of Muslim Spain and the discovery of the Americas in 1492, and Martin Luther's Protestant Reformation in 1517. In England the modern period is often dated to the start of the Tudor period with the victory of Henry VII over <a2_0>Richard III<a2_0/> at the <a1_0>Battle of Bosworth in 1485<a1_0/>. Early modern European history is usually seen to span from the start of the 15th century, through the Age of Reason and the Age of Enlightenment in the 17th and 18th centuries, until the beginning of the Industrial Revolution in the late 18th century.
